How does Verus Vault protect against the "5 dollar wrench attack"?

Verus Vault protects against the "5 dollar wrench attack" by allowing you to set a delay between unlocking your VerusID and being able to spend funds from it. This delay can be set to a predetermined time, such as 24 hours, giving you or a trusted third party (such as a company that monitors the blockchain) time to revoke and recover your identity in case of an unauthorized unlock attempt.

#### Verus Vault With Verus Vault you can now protect funds on a VerusID, even from theft of a private key! If you lock your VerusID with Vault you cannot spend funds from that identity at all until it is again unlocked. While locked, you can still stake those same funds on the Verus network and earn by doing so. At the same time, anyone with only the primary keys, even a multisig of primary keys must first unlock, then wait for the predetermined unlock time before they can spend or access funds. This gives you, or maybe a company that specializes in watching the blockchain to whom you've assigned the revocation ID to revoke and recover whenever an unauthorized unlock occurs.
